{"step_by_step_thinking": "CSF Rhinorrhoea is the leakage of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose. This usually occurs due to a fracture or defect in the skull base. The cribriform plate, a thin, delicate bone that separates the cranial cavity from the nasal cavity, is the most common site of CSF leaks due to its thinness and close proximity to the nasal cavity.", "answer_choice": "D. Cribriform plate"}
